text: Characterization of a <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> leukosialin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated pathway for inducing apoptosis in human T-lymphoblastoid cells .
The monoclonal antibody ( mAb ) J393 induces apoptosis in Jurkat T-cells .

NH2-terminal amino acid sequence analysis identified the 140-kDa surface antigen for mAb J393 as <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> leukosialin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , the major sialoglycoprotein of leukocytes .

While Jurkat cells co - expressed two discrete cell-surface isoforms of <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , recognized by mAb J393 and mAb G10-2 , respectively , only J393 / <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaled apoptosis .

J393 / <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was found to be hyposialylated , bearing predominantly O - linked monosaccharide glycans , whereas G10-2 / <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> bore complex sialylated tetra - and hexasaccharide chains .

Treatment with soluble , bivalent mAb J393 killed 25-50 % of the cell population , while concomitant engagement of either the CD3.TcR complex or the integrins <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD29 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> significantly potentiated this effect .
Treatment of Jurkat cells with mAb J393 induced tyrosine phosphorylation of specific protein substrates that underwent hyperphosphorylation upon antigen receptor costimulation .

Tyrosine kinase inhibition by herbimycin A diminished J393 / <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis , whereas inhibition of phosphotyrosine phosphatase activity by bis ( maltolato ) oxovanadium-IV enhanced cell death .

Signal transduction through tyrosine kinase activation may lead to altered gene expression , as J393 / <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation prompted decreases in the nuclear localization of the transcriptional regulatory protein NF-kappaB and proteins binding the interferon - inducible regulatory element .

Since peripheral blood T-lymphocytes express cryptic epitopes for mAb J393 , these findings demonstrate the existence of a tightly regulated <extra_id_0> CD43 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated pathway for inducing apoptosis in human T-cell lineages .
